answers.answer: Dopomoha (Help) is a web support and information platform designed for migrants fleeing the war in Ukraine. It provides information on entry requirements at the border, procedures for seeking asylum in Romania, rights and obligations as asylum seekers, and useful resources for their stay in Romania. The platform is available in Romanian, Ukrainian, English, and Russian, accessible via any device through a browser, and is regularly updated with verified information from official sources. Dopomoha is a project created by Code for Romania in partnership with the Department for Emergency Situations (DSU), The UN Refugee Agency, International Organization for Migration (OIM), and the National Romanian Council for Refugees (CNRR), and is a Commit Global solution.
answers.bResponse: Dopomoha (Help) is a web support and information platform designed for migrants fleeing the war in Ukraine. It provides information on entry requirements at the border, procedures for seeking asylum in Romania, rights and obligations as asylum seekers, and useful resources for their stay in Romania. The platform is available in Romanian, Ukrainian, English, and Russian, accessible via any device through a browser, and is regularly updated with verified information from official sources. Dopomoha is a project created by Code for Romania in partnership with the Department for Emergency Situations (DSU), The UN Refugee Agency, International Organization for Migration (OIM), and the National Romanian Council for Refugees (CNRR), and is a Commit Global solution. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/about

answers.answer: Dopomoha provides reliable, timely, and straightforward information for migrants fleeing the war in Ukraine. This includes details on entry requirements at the border, the procedure for seeking asylum in Romania, the rights and obligations of asylum seekers, and useful resources for their stay in Romania. The platform aims to answer questions and worries about safely entering and navigating a new country.

answers.answer: The text does not mention specific Romanian cities in relation to Dopomoha's direct scope. Dopomoha is described as a web support and information platform for migrants fleeing the war in Ukraine, accessible from any device, and intended for all displaced migrants in Romania. While a list of cities, including Brașov, Brăila, Constanța, Galați, Iași, Oradea, Suceava, Sibiu, Cluj-Napoca, and Timișoara, is present on the page, it appears under a general "Other cities" section related to various support categories (Housing, Education, Health, Transportation, Call center), rather than specifically defining Dopomoha's geographical reach.
